alert.note: Alert for Buncombe (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Wind Advisory issued November 27 at 9:24PM EST until November 28 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM EST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Northwest winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts of 35 to 45 mph in the valley and 40 to 50 mph in the higher elevations. * WHERE...Buncombe County. * WHEN...Until 1 PM EST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. Tree limbs could be blown down and a few power outages may result. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Peak gusts will be highly variable around Buncombe County overnight through midday Tuesday. The strongest gusts will occur over the eastern half of the county and likely maximize on Tuesday morning. At least a few gusts greater than 45 mph are possible just about anywhere in the county, including the City of Asheville, during the Advisory period.
info.instruction: Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects.
